result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel S Haynes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel S Haynes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel S Haynes was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Daniel S Haynes was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to all other cases (Chippewa Co case 15CF163, Eau Claire Co case 14CF1117 and Buffalo Co case 17CF121).  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: all other cases (Chippewa Co case 15CF163, Eau Claire Co case 14CF1117 and Buffalo Co case 17CF121).

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

supervisions.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

Concur to ct 1 and all other cases (Chippewa Co case 15CF163, Eau Claire Co case 14CF1117 and Buffalo Co case 17CF121).  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).
Concurrent with: ct 1 and all other cases (Chippewa Co case 15CF163, Eau Claire Co case 14CF1117 and Buffalo Co case 17CF121).

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 4/27/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:53 AM Defendant in court with Attorney William Richard Jones.  ADA Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1 and 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1 
Court sentences DE to:
-serve 39 months in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 15 months
-extended supervision: 2 years
-cc to Count 2 and all other cases (Chippewa 15CF163, Eau Claire 14CF1117 and Buffalo 17CF121)

Challenge Incarceration Program: Not Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

COUNT #3 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 90 days in Jail, to be served in the WSP

-Days credit for time served:  111 days
-Days credit to jail: 111 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1 and 3
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes emailed to DOC

4/27/22 AMENDED MINUTES
Ct 2 Concur to ct 1 and all other cases (Chippewa Co case 15CF163, Eau Claire Co case 14CF1117 and Buffalo Co case 17CF121).  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2). 111 days credit applies to prison and jail. - Cassandra S

Status conference on April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:09 PM IN CUSTODY

Defendant Daniel S Haynes in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 2

02:09 PM IN CUSTODY

Defendant Daniel S Haynes in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin. Officer J.R., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Woodard. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over, waived argument. CT finds that counts 1 and 2 are transactionally related CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 2.
